thread.title: "It’s a shock" and "a nightmare" says stunned Arsene Wenger of Arsenal's Bayern battering
thread.title_full: "It’s a shock" and "a nightmare" says stunned Arsene Wenger of Arsenal's Bayern battering

author: John Cross
title: "It’s a shock" and "a nightmare" says stunned Arsene Wenger of Arsenal's Bayern battering
text:
Sport "It’s a shock" and "a nightmare" says stunned Arsene Wenger of Arsenal's Bayern battering The Gunners look doomed to a SEVENTH successive Champions League last-16 elimination after a drubbing that will increase calls for the manager to go Share Wenger's contract is up in the summer — many Arsenal fans won't want him to stay that long now (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsene Wenger suffered a “nightmare” defeat to leave his future as Arsenal boss in serious doubt, writes John Cross in Munich . 
Manager Wenger was left shell-shocked after an embarrassing second-half surrender in a 5-1 away loss to Bayern which leaves them facing a seventh successive Champions League last-16 exit. 
The Frenchman, 67 years old and out of contract at the end of the season, will face fresh calls for him to go after one of the worst nights of his 20-year Gunners reign. 
Arsenal went in at the break with the score 1-1, then unravelled. 
Wenger said: “I do not look for excuses, I give explanations. It’s a shock. 
"Tonight we made everything wrong — the fifth goal shows that. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsene Wenger gives dejected interview after Bayern defeat Share this video Watch Next 
“I felt third goal was killer because after that we had no response. 
"We lost our organisation and we looked mentally jaded and vulnerable from that moment onwards. The last 25 minutes was a nightmare for us. 
“Overall I must say they are a better team than us, they played very well in the second half and we dropped our level. We were a bit unlucky we dropped our level and they were better than us. 
“I felt we had two good chances to score just before half-time. I felt we were unlucky for the second goal — the referee gave a corner for us at first. Read More Agony for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain as Arsenal's European dreams end for another year (Photo: Reuters) Alexis Sanchez and the Gunners will surely be sitting out the remaining rounds (Photo: Reuters) Read More The nine most HUMILIATING stats for Arsenal fans after Wednesday's loss 
"Then we concede the second goal and then the most important was that we lost Laurent Koscielny. We collapsed.” 
Arsenal have failed to get past the last 16 since 2010 but Gunners legend Ian Wright called the performance a “shambles” on Twitter — and it will only increase calls for him to go. 
When asked if it is his lowest point, Wenger replied: "How I feel, I don't think, is the most important. But of course, it is disappointing.” 
“I don’t know what happened in the second half," said keeper David Ospina. Read More Reserve keeper Ospina was left reeling as Arsenal conceded four after the break (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) Read More ANDY DUNN: One of Wenger's worst nights as Arsenal boss - how much more can he take? 
"They attacked us and we could not contain them. In the second leg we will try. It is difficult when you do not play too much but you do what you have to do.” 
Looking ahead to the dead-rubber second leg in a fortnight, Bayern boss Carlo Ancelotti understated: "We have the advantage." poll loading What should Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger do? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
